channel.title: Unable To Connect to Server (317) (Probably Stupid Mistake)
channel.description:
I recently got back to playing rsps, and thought on working on mine again. (so yes I'm a newbie at coding but you gotta start somewhere) and i forgot the simple way to change the ip on a 317. I went into the Server.java and Client.java and change all them ips and such and portforwarded, but still saying unable to connect to server. So either I screwed something up or I missed a step, but i wouldn't mind if someone would look at it for me, It should be an easy fix. The Port Checker said the port was open so I don't understand what I'm exactly doing wrong?
Thanks.

item.title: Unable To Connect to Server (317) (Probably Stupid Mistake)
item.dc:creator: @bananastreet bananastreet
item.description:
@bananastreet wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:4, topic:517943”]your port is probably closed check at canyouseeme.org

Btw if you just want to login just use 127.0.0.1.[/quote]

It says “Success: I can see your service on “Server Ip Here” on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594”

Read full topic

item.title: Unable To Connect to Server (317) (Probably Stupid Mistake)
item.dc:creator: @bananastreet bananastreet
item.description:
@bananastreet wrote:

[quote=“MrFun, post:2, topic:517943”]Did you change it in your client folder? I know somewhere in your client theres a ip thing you need to do
heres what I found in my client folder

server = "127.0.0.1"; port = "43594";[/quote]

Yeah i did that…

if(myPrivilege >= 2 || server.equals("bananascape-pk.no-ip.biz") || 1 == 1) { if(inputString.equals("region")) { System.out.println("Current region: " + anInt1069 + ", " + anInt1070);
